I don't know if it was intended to be a cold dish or hot dish but I didn't like it, $6.95. 

We had leftovers to take home.  Hubby says if he goes back, it'd be to try another noodle dish.
author: Ry T.

description: A new restaurant with lots of potential. Decor is nice but funny thing is it is Japanese themed (I think the place was previously a Japanese restaurant). Relaxed and comfortable ambience. The lady who owns the place is said to be known for her pulled noodle (la mien). She came out to talk to all the customers. Friendly, but my Mandarin sucks so I could barely communicate. Anyway, I tried the Tomato noodle. The noodles had great texture. Soup was good, subtle and lots of yummy mushrooms and vegetables. My husband had the pot herb mustard pork noodle dish. He really liked it too. Portions are huge. We should have ordered just one bowl to share. Overall, a great meal. Definitely going back to try the other dishes and will try to post photos next time.
author: Gillian Y.

description: Food is ok. Dumpling taste is just ordinary and skin is too thick with less stuffing. Service is suck because of language proficiency and such a tiny restaurant with serving slow. Seem like some people just came here for pot stickers and dumplings. Tried noodle but also is just ok taste with cheap price. 2 stars for dumplings only.
author: Howwie C.

description:
avoid at all cost... 

service was slow.  the xlb were steamed for too long and have all clearly exploded with the inside spilling out and visibly destroyed but they still presented to me.  that's the level of respect they have for what they serve and their customers.  i sent them back to the kitchen.   rest of the food were so salty i got a headache.
author: Adele W.

description:
Wife and husband team with one helper in the kitchen, one not very experienced wait staff, running  this 40 seats restaurant. 

I have visited this place three times during the last three weeks.  When the pace is slow, food and service were fine. But when it is more than half full,  the kitchen get overwhelmed, food quality went downhill fast. At the same time, the lone wait staff, although trying very hard, failed to keep up with the customers.  I hope the owners will correct these short comings soon.   

If you want to have a good experience with Shandong Deluxe, go there during off peak periods, that means early or late meal hours, and no weekends.  



.
author: Andrew P.

description: Authentic noodles and dumplings made on site.  Chives pan cake is the real deal!!
author: Sans S.

description:
We went there on a sunday afternoon; it was almost 2pm when we got there.  The restaurant was full of customers, only 2 small tables were empty, but we have 4 adults + 1 toddler and waited for 20 min or so.  When we sat down, I found people from 3 other big tables just finished and left!  Anyways, we ordered beef tendon noodle soup, onion pancake, Xiao Long Bao, pan fried pork dumplings, and pork and bak choi dumplings.  They are quite tasty, and the portion of beef tendon noodle is quite large!  The service is a little bit slow, and the tea is not hot.  But the food came out quite fast.  I think they are improving.  I personally would like to come to this one rather than king of dumplings (their wait is even longer and service also not as good, and their tables and chairs are too packed).

BTW. There was no waitress, only 2 waiters.  I think they fired the waitress yelper Wilson Y. mentioned in his review...
author: Cat. C.

description: My Wife & I at there last night, The Noodle soups were amazing! and the green beans were also fantastic. The Mapo Tufu was decent , but the weakest out of the list. I might be partial to how my wife makes it and there is many different styles to the dish, so it was just so so. My wife liked the noodles even a little more then King of Noodles, I think it could be, def the meat in the soup was allot less fatty then King of noodles. Either way, it is great to see more Mainland Chinese Restaurants opening. The people working there were very nice and the prices good, we will be back, next time Jiaozi!
author: dub g.

description: The service was terrible. I wanted to order take out and had some questions about the dish, like how spicy it is and how big is it. The waiter replied me "please hurry, we are busy here." We ordered and it took us almost 1 hour. We had to cancel one of our order otherwise it will take longer. They never apologize, never smile, never care about you.
author: Hsin C.

description:
I came here with hub last week because I've passed by it often and been wanting to try it. It was Halloween evening around 6pm and the place was almost filled. We were seated near the kitchen area. We ordered a pork/chives steamed dumplings, pan fried pork buns, and the xingjiang beef lo mein. Food came after a decent amount of time. Server was lukewarm, not too warm nor cold. The dumplings were ok, filling was good. The pan fried buns weren't so great, meat was dry. The noodles was not tasty and they advertised it!! The sauce tasted like a cross between ketchup and hot sauce. But anyways since we live in the neighborhood we decided to give it a 2nd try tonight....another Wed evening around 5:30pm,
Upon arrival only 2 tables were filled. Hub wanted to try their spicy beef soup noodles. We ordered that , a shredded pork stir fry with green bell peppers, &a bowl of pork/fungus/egg flower sauce noodles. After 15 minutes the dish came....then half way thru the dish, the server walked by and told us over her shoulder, " your noodles coming soon." 5 min later it came. Hub said the the beef was good but the soup was just spicy water. 10 min later I asked the server when my noodles would come. She looked at me as if I said something wrong. I asked her again. She said, "did you order it? I didn't write it down." No apology whatsoever. I told her I did and asked if she could make it fast. She said she would have to ask the cook. 10 min later it came. It tasted just ok.
So...I don't think we will return....didn't like the service, attitude, food was just ok, nothing to rave about. Unless they improve.
author: agnes f.

description: Cash only, no matter what. Doesn't post that any where. Horrible service, couldn't even get a side of rice....really!?!?
author: Joanna Z.

description: Servise was horrible! During the rush hour, the signing sheet was nothing but a decoration. There was no sense of management and organization at all! My family and I already sat down at a table (which we basically cleaned ourselves) and placed the order, but we were asked to get up and have the other group to sit at our cleaned table.  It was just extramely rediculous and disrespectful to the customer! My family and I will never go to such a lousy restaurant again!
author: Vivian H.

description: To be honest, their noodles are pretty good.... But everything else... Can't compare to kingdom of dumpling... And most important, the services is BAD
author: Tim L.

description: (Account confusion-between devices-apologies)Everything already said about the service is true.  I guess they just don't care about their customers time. Unbelievably slow. Friendly enough. Come for the dumplings. Lamb in particular were good.  I had spicy pork noodle. Boring.  Noodles weren't that special to me. Nothing that bowled me over. The table next to us ONLY ordered dumplings and dim sum. Smart. Their hot sauce on table is tasty. Not super hot but flavorful.
author: Michelle M.

description: This place sucks. Their customer service is horrible. You have to keep asking for every little thing and they lag on everything. They do not even acknowledge you when you walk in (you have to walk up to them). Seating is cramped. We ordered the sam sun noodles, spicy beef noodles, and the shanghai soup dumplings. The spicy beef noodle (super oily, fatty, no flavor) and the shanghai soup dumplings were ok (have had a lot better at other places), but the sam sun noodles had a nasty after taste and just didn't taste right. I think it's great that they make their own noodles and own shanghai dumplings, but the taste isn't there. Will not be back.
author: Ellen T.

description:
Long wait; not worth it. Each dish comes VERY slowly and sporadically, waiter brought wrong order b/c he said he wasn't use to the new menu numbers.  No apology. another really long wait for the correct dish to come.

Crab dumping overshadowed by the dense meat.
Large belt noodles w/ chicken and red peppers: not enough noodles and chicken had too many splintered bone pieces.
Lamb dumplings: these were good.
Service: poor
Won't be coming back.
author: Pat W.

description: This is the worst restaurant I have ever eaten at.  Their was literally no taste to the dishes, the service was less than poor (we never even got our complete order).  If I wasn't an ethical person, I would have gotten up and left and not paid the bill.  This food was inedible.  DON'T EAT HERE!
author: Patricia J.

description: The food is super delicious, but the service is so-so. I usually have to go get my own menu and have to flag the waiters down to get their attention. The place is also pretty cramped too and it's cash only. However, their food makes up for all the negatives! My favorite dishes are the beef wrap, xinjiang cold noodle, and chinese spinache dumplings. I always order these every time i go! Price is also super cheap. 2 people can definitely dine for about $20 and you'll be stuffed!
author: Annie L.

description:
Northern Chinese food closer to 19th than Kingdom of Dumpling? Count me in for a try~

Food Quality is AMAZING. People have recommended their noodles, and I have to join them. If you don't get anything else there, get something with noodles in it. Their hand-pulled noodles are definitely something to come back for. 

- Spicy Beef Tendon: I guess I'm bias toward the Kingdom of Dumpling version's thin slices. The one here is quite thick in comparison, but just as delicious.

- Onion Pancakes: These are probably the best I have found on Taraval so far. Highest of quality, the perfect amount of dough. It's on par with my former favorite Northern Chinese food restaurant in Milbrae. 

- XLB (Xiao Long Bao): Could have been more soupy, but other than that, it was quite enjoyable.

- Beef Tendon Noodle: They are quite generous with their tendon here. Soup was good, and of course their noodles were divine. They could have added a bit more vegetables, but other than that it was enough food between me and my guest.

Service: Could have been better, but they were really busy (even for a Wednesday night), and didn't really notice our small table. 

Over all a fantastic experience food wise. I would recommend this to anyone who is having an inkling for fantastic quality noodles.
author: Jess H.

description: Fast service, surprisingly clean for a Chinese restaurant and the food was excellent! We tried the cucumber appetizer, bean curd, tripe, shanghai dumplings, and the spicy beef noodles which were all very good. Their homemade hot sauce was delicious. Best of all, the place was stroller friendly which always wins bonus points for us! Will def come back again.
author: Lydia A.

description:
This is a small new restaurant that  overall exceeded my expectation. good for party up to about 4 (have two tables can accommodate 6 peoples . noise level good. can speak and hear @ reasonable level, cost (party of 6 about 100 dollars (including tax and tip) Service was rapid and good. Dumpling were delicious, noodles was good. 


Plan to go there with a smaller party next time.

PLEASE NOTE: CASH ONLY
author: Howard L.

description: Came here today for lunch with my parents. The restaurant is small with a very limited seating. So sometimes there will be quite a wait. We actually accidentally found this restaurant, my dad saw that they do hand pulled noodles so we decided to try this place out. Their dumplings are pretty good. I got the pork, shrimp and chives ones. The chives weren't overpowering and you can still taste the pork and shrimp. Very well balanced. Their green onion pancake are pretty greasy for not being that golden brown. We ordered the spicy beef noodle and the beef tendon noodle. I wasn't such a fan of the spicy beef noodle, it's just sour and spicy. The beef tendon noodle (is not spicy) had a nice mushroom tasting broth to it which I thought was quite nice. They also give you a nice big bowl with a good amount of noodle. The staff here are pretty forgetful and it is hard to get their attention. Also, their English isn't very good so you might have to repeat things to do a few more times. Probably wouldn't come here again for their noodle but instead their dumplings.
author: Tiffany Y.

description: i got their spicy sichuan noodle soup and it was very delicious. but my friend's beef stew noodle was no good at all, kinda like hand-pulled noodle in plain broth...to someone who is used to the saucy, cantonese beef stew, the beef stew noodle was quite disappointing (but then again this place is NOT cantonese style)...i would recommend getting their beef wrap because they put sauce INSIDE the wrap, totally different from that of taiwanese style! overall this place is decent but just make sure you look at pictures beforehand and get the right thing.
author: Louis O.

description: To be honest, their noodles are pretty good.... But everything else... Can't compare to kingdom of dumpling... And most important, the services is BAD
author: Tim L.

description: Came in for an early dinner and was seated quickly. The waitress helped us pick items and explained the different options. It helps if you know Mandarin. We ordered a few dishes, one was the lamb lai mein (hand pulled noodles) soup or at least that's what I'm calling. It was unique, three or four different kinds of noodles but had a lot of white pepper added and made it spicier for others. If you can't eat pepper or do not like your soup too spicy make sure to tell the waitress when you order. The green onion pancake was supper thin and crispy so if you like it this way like I do then it is a must order! We order the fennel dumplings and vegetarian dumplings. Both were good and look forward to try different kinds. Arrive early as it is a small place recommended for parties of 4 or less.
author: D. M.

author: Jasmine H.

description: After spending 2 1/2 hours at a doctor appointment at UCSF, I was hungry.  We stumbled upon this place after parking across from Dragon City only to find it is now Taraval Seafood House.  So, not sure about trying it, we crossed back over to Shan Dong.  It is a casual atmosphere with friendly efficient service and low prices and excellent food to boot.  The lamb dumplings are delicate with thin wrappers, tender lamb filling, and a little broth inside like xiao lung baos; perfect with the sauce over it.  The beef wraps are chewy but not overly so with tender beef, onions, and cucumbers.  The Mongolian beef is tender with not as much beef and more vegetables with crisp onions and peppers in a vinigrey chuili sauce; it is ass kickin spicy; so you better have water nearby and some rice.  I can hardly wait to go back and try other things.  So, for excellent Shan Dong cuisine at low prices in a casual atmosphere with friendly service, Shan Dong cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.
